member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart
member.summary: The xamChart control provides a framework for creating charting applications, or adding charting capability to existing data or information-driven applications.
member.remarks: The xamChart control contains a collection of charts. Each individual chart has many of the same properties as xamChart itself: Series, Axes, Legend, Caption, Lights, Transform3D, etc. In addition, each individual chart contains its own chart collection. Because each chart contain a collection of charts, you can create nested charts where each chart can have multiple parent charts inside its boundaries. When you use a chart as a parent (that is, it has children inside the chart collection), it doesn't display chart data; it is only used as a container of other charts.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart.DataSourceRefresh
member.summary: Perform a data binding. The DataSource property of a series has to be set before this method is called.
member.remarks: This method should be called only if the data source cannot be refreshed automatically in run time. A is created for every record, and the property of the data point will be filled with a value from the specified data source. The series will be filled with created data points. If property is not specified, only the property from data point will be set. To fill or (Chart parameters keep values for Stock or Scatter chart types), the property from the series has to be used.

member.summary: When a UIElement is added to the logical tree, properties of the UIElement are set from the tree. Every time when a property is set the refresh method is called. This property is used to prevent refreshing when UIElements are added to the visual tree.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart.DataBind
member.summary: This event occurs immediately after data binding. This event is used to change color or appearance of data points after binding.
member.remarks: When data binding is used a new series without data points has to be created. Data binding process will create data points and set Value property from data points using values from the data source. To change color or other properties of data points we have to use data bind event after data binding to specify new values. DataBind event occurs only ones after binding, for all series from the chart.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart.ChartRendering
member.summary: This event occurs before the chart is rendered.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart.ChartRendered
member.summary: This event occurs after the chart is rendered.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart.Series
member.summary: The collection of data series which are used to provide data to the chart.
member.remarks: When a chart is deployed on the page, a default column chart appears with two series. This default chart does not contain any data, but when the chart is placed into a visual design surface, the chart automatically creates demo data to give it some appearance will it is being worked with, or until you supply your data. As soon as you add actual data to the control, the demo data disappears from the chart. You cannot change the sample data because it does not exist in the Series collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart.Axes
member.summary: Gets the axis collection. Every axis has an AxisType which could be PrimaryX, PrimaryY, PrimaryZ, SecondaryX and SecondaryY.
member.remarks: By default, the chart's axes do not exist in the Axes collection; however, internally, default axes are created. If you don't want to modify the appearance or range of the axes, grid lines, or axis labels, you can simply use the default values of the axes. If you want to change the default axis values, you need to create an axis and add it to the Axes collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart.Transform3D
member.summary: Gets or sets Transformation Matrix for 3D charts that provides all three-dimensional transformations, including translation, rotation, and scale transformations.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart.Caption
member.summary: Gets or sets the chart caption. Keeps information about text value, font, color and position for a Chart title.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart.Scene
member.summary: Gets or sets the scene which contains information related to chart scene appearance. The scene is different for 2D and 3D chart. For 2D chart it is used for Background color and position. For 3D chart it also containes thicknes of the 3D scene.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart.Legend
member.summary: Gets or sets the chart legend. The chart legend box appears alongside the chart border. It is used to give text description for every data point or series appearance in the chart. Many qualities of the legend are dependent upon ChartType.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart.View3D
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the chart is rendered in 3D.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart.RefreshEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether refreshing of the chart is enabled.
member.remarks: This property has to be used every time when data are changed in runtime to improve performance of the rendering. For example, if we have observable collection which is used as a and we change values in the collection, every time when a value is changed the chart will be drawn. Similar case is changing data point values in run time. To stop refreshing the chart RefreshEnabled property has to be set to false before we change data and back to true after data is changed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart.Lights
member.summary: Gets Collection with lights that represent lighting applied to a 3-D scene. Used for 3D charts only.
member.remarks: For 3D charts, by default, a light effect is created with default values (one DirectionalLight, and one PointLight). However, if you want to change the Light effects for the 3D scene, you need to create a Light effect and add it to the Lights collection. When you add a Light effect to the collection, the default Light effects disappear, and only newly created Light effects are used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart.StartPaletteBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets the start Brush which is used to create a palette of colors for data points and series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart.EndPaletteBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets the end Brush which is used to create a palette of colors for data points and series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart.Theme
member.summary: Gets or sets the default look for the control.

remarks.para: If left set to null then the default 'Generic' theme will be used. This property can be set to the name of any registered theme (see and methods).

Note: The following themes are pre-registered by this assembly but additional themes can be registered as well.
"Generic" - the default theme.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.XamChart.DrawException
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether an exception is drawn as a string message on the screen. Otherwise, exception will be thrown.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Chart
member.summary: Chart contains basic chart elements: Grids, Axes, Labels, Data Points, Legends, Titles, etc. The Chart control can have many Charts as a nested elements.
member.remarks:
The xamChart control contains a collection of charts. Each individual chart has many of the same properties as xamChart itself: Series, Axes, Legend, Caption, Lights, Transform3D, etc. In addition, each individual chart contains its own chart collection. Because each chart contain a collection of charts, you can create nested charts where each chart can have multiple parent charts inside its boundaries. When you use a chart as a parent (that is, it has children inside the chart collection), it doesn't display chart data; it is only used as a container of other charts.
Important - The nested chart functionality is disabled for the first release. Public properties from this class are not used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Chart.Series
member.summary: The collection of data series which are used to provide data to the chart.
member.remarks: When a chart is deployed on the page, a default column chart appears with two series. This default chart does not contain any data, but when the chart is placed into a visual design surface, the chart automatically creates demo data to give it some appearance will it is being worked with, or until you supply your data. As soon as you add actual data to the control, the demo data disappears from the chart. You cannot change the sample data because it does not exist in the Series collection.

When you add a Light effect to the collection, the default Light effect disappears, and only newly created Light effects can be used.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.GdiGraphics
member.summary: This class is used for fast 2D rendering. It encapsulates GDI+ Graphics. If data points are drawn using WPF rendering engine (FrameworkElements or DrawingContext), drawing is very slow, especially for big number of data points. So the solution is to use GDI+ drawing for big number of data points. Disadvantage of this approach is that some of WPF features will not work (Animation, DataTemplates, etc.) This rendering is used only for GridArea and all other chart elements (Axis Labels, Legend, etc) are drawn using WPF rendering.

member.param: True if Anti Alias is on

The first way is to use WPF animation which is supported as Transformation animation, Brush animation, etc. The second way is to use Animation class which is part of Infragistics.Windows.Chart namespace. This animation is used for some complex cases where WPF animation cannot be used. This animation is implemented inside chart control.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis
member.summary: Axis provides base set of properties and methods used for data range calculation and visual presentation of axis line. Axis also contains Gridlines, tickmarks and labels.

remarks.p: There are a few different ways how axis could be used and it depends on selected chart type. For example, column chart display values on vertical axis and categories on the horizontal axis. Bar chart uses horizontal axis for values and vertical for categories. Scatter chart types use both horizontal and vertical axes for values. Some chart types as doughnut or pie do not use axes.

By default, the chart's axis does not exist in the Axes collection; however, internally, default axes are created. If you don't want to modify the appearance or range of the axes, grid lines, or axis labels, you can simply use the default values of the axes. If you want to change the the default axis values, you need to create an axis and add it to the Axes collection.

member.summary: Gets an enumerator for this element's logical child elements.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.AxisType
member.summary: Gets or sets the axis type for this axis. This property is also used to enable secondary axes.
member.remarks: The axis type can be PrimaryX, PrimaryY, PrimaryZ, SecondaryX and SecondaryY. The default value is PrimaryX.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.Maximum
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum limit of the Axis range. To create manual range property has to be set to false and , Maximum and have to be set.
member.remarks: If minimum or maximum value is NaN the axis range is automatically calculated. If Maximum is used on a category axis, the value is rounded to the smallest integer greater than or equal to the specified number. The default value is NaN.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.Minimum
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum limit of the Axis range. To create manual range property has to be set to false and Minimum, and have to be set.
member.remarks: If minimum or maximum value is NaN the axis range is automatically calculated. If Minimum is used on a category axis, the value is rounded to the smallest integer greater than or equal to the specified number. The default value is NaN.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.Unit
member.summary: Gets or sets a distance between two neighboring axis labels, gridlines and tick marks. The Unit value uses axis scale. If the Unit is 0, Axis Unit is automatically calculated.
member.remarks: For logarithmic axes, the Unit value will represent interval of the linearlized scale. For example if and values are 10 and 10000 the linearlized minimum and maximum will be 1 and 4 (1=Log(10) and 4=Log(10000). If the Unit for this linearlized scale is 1 the axis will have 4 labels: 10, 100, 1000, 10000. The default value for Unit is 0.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.AutoRange
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the , and are automatically calculated. To create manual range AutoRange property has to be set to false and Minimum, Maximum and Unit have to be set.
member.remarks: By default, chart determines the minimum and maximum range values of the axis. You can customize the scale to better meet your needs. The default value for AutoRange is true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.RangeFromZero
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the zero value is inside the auto range.
member.remarks: By default the chart control calculates minimum and maximum values for the axis. For non scatter chart types 0 value will be inside the range defined by minimum and maximum values. For example if data points have values: 112, 117 and 114 the auto minimum and maximum values will be 0 and 160. If RangeFromZero property is set to false the auto minimum and maximum values will be: 110 and 118. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.Logarithmic
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the logarithmic scale is enabled.
member.remarks: The logarithm for a base b and a number x is defined to be the inverse function of taking b to the power x. This property is used for value axes only (in most cases it is Y axes, except scatter chart types which have all axes as a value axis). For category axes this property is ignored (for no scatter chart types category axes are X and Z). The default value is false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.LogarithmicBase
member.summary: Gets or sets a base for logarithmic scale.
member.remarks: The logarithm for a base b and a number x is defined to be the inverse function of taking b to the power x. The default value for LogarithmicBase is 10.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.Crossing
member.summary: Gets or sets an axis value where this axis crosses another axis.
member.remarks: The default value for Crossing is 0.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.Stroke
member.summary: Gets or sets the Brush that specifies how to paint the axis line.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.StrokeThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the axis line.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.Animation
member.summary: Gets or sets the animation for Axis line. This animation draws the line from minimum to maximum axis position.
member.remarks: This animation is only used to create growing effect for the line, but Axis line animation could be also created using brush property and WPF animation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.MajorGridline
member.summary: Gets or sets the Major Gridline.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.MinorGridline
member.summary: Gets or sets the Minor Gridline.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.MinorTickMark

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.Stripes

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.Label
member.summary: Gets or sets the Axis Labels

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the axis is visible.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Axis.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the Axis Name. Used for secondary Axes to make connection between Series and Axes.
member.remarks: Every series needs X and Y axes for 2D charts and X, Y and Z axes for 3D charts. Every chart scene can have 6 axes 3 Primary and 3 secondary. For example, series can use only one X axis, and it could be primary or secondary. To specify which axis we want to use we have to set the same text for AxisNameX property of the Series and the Name property of an axis. If those properties are empty the primary axes are used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Caption.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text contents of a Caption.
member.remarks: A string specifying the content of the Caption. The default value is Empty.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Caption.Margin
member.summary: Gets or sets the outer margin of an element using percent value from 0 to 100. This property doesn't have any effect if MarginType property is set to Auto.
member.remarks: The property uses percent as an unit, which means that the values for the left, top, right, and bottom of the bounding rectangle have to be values between 0 and 100. This relative layout will produce proportional resizing of the chart elements.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Caption.MarginType
member.summary: Gets or sets a margin type for the chart element. If MarginType property is Percent, the Margin property has to be set.
member.remarks: The margin type can be set to Auto or Percent. The default value is Auto, and the position of the chart element is automatically created. For manual positioning the MarginType has to be set to Percent.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Caption.FontFamily
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the specified font.
member.remarks: A FontFamily object specifying prefered font family. If font doesnt exist, there is one or more fallback font families. The default value is the font determined by the MessageFontFamily metric.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Caption.FontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the font size of the caption text.
member.remarks: A double value specifying the desired font size to use in points (1 point = 1/72 of an inch = 96/72 device independent pixels). The default value is determined by the MessageFontSize metric.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Caption.FontStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the font style for the caption text.
member.remarks: The default value for FontStyle is Normal.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Caption.FontWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the weight or thickness of the specified font.
member.remarks: A FontWeight enumeration value. The default value is Normal.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Caption.FontStretch
member.summary: Gets or sets the degree to which a font is condensed or expanded on the screen.
member.remarks: A member of the FontStretch class specifying the desired font-stretching characteristics to use. The default value is Normal.

member.remarks: The margin type can be set to Auto or Percent. The default value is Auto, and the position of the chart element is automatically created. For manual positioning the MarginType has to be set to Percent.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.GridAreaRenderingDetails.ForceSolidBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets Force Solid Brush. If the value is true only solid color brush is used. This significantly improves performance and this is used only for Performance rendering mode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.GridAreaRenderingDetails.AllowDataPointBrush
member.summary: Gets or set a value which indicates whether data point brushes are used. For Performance mode, by default, only series colors are used and all data points have same colors. This significantly improves performance and memory usage.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.GridAreaRenderingDetails.AutoModePointsNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets auto mode points number. This number is used when Rendering Mode is set to auto. The Performance mode is active when the number of data points from all series is greater than AutoModePointsNumber. If number of points is less then this number the rendering mode is Full. When rendering mode is set to Full or Performance this number is ignored. Default value is 1000.

member.remarks: A double value specifying the desired font size to use in points (1 point = 1/72 of an inch = 96/72 device independent pixels). The default value is determined by the MessageFontSize metric.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Label.FontStyle

member.remarks: The default value for FontStyle is Normal.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Label.FontWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the weight or thickness of the specified font.
member.remarks: A FontWeight enumeration value. The default value is Normal.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Label.FontStretch
member.summary: Gets or sets the degree to which a font is condensed or expanded on the screen.
member.remarks: A member of the FontStretch class specifying the desired font-stretching characteristics to use. The default value is Normal.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Label.Foreground
member.summary: Gets or sets the Brush to apply to the text contents of labels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Label.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets data point label format using the .NET Framework composite string formatting.
member.remarks: This property is used to format axis label string. Axis label should use axis label value which will be formatted on specified way and inserted into a text. Axis label format uses .NET Composite Formatting specification. The {0} text is replaced with axis label value. For example, to create a label which displays a text Label value is: 3 where 3 is axis label value, we have to create a following format string Label value is: {0}. Few more examples: 1. Product price is: $3.00 dollars -> Product price is: {0:C} dollars. 2. Calculated value is: 03.00 -> Calculated value is: {0:00.00}. For more information about format property see Composite Formatting in .NET Framework Developers Guide.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Label.AutoResize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the axis labels have automatic font size.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Label.DistanceFromAxis
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between axis and labels. This is scaling factor applied to the default distance. Value 1 is default distance, a value between 0 and 1 decrease the default distance and a value greater than 1 increase the default distance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Label.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the axis labels are visible.

member.summary: Gets or sets 3D Scene Thickness.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Scene.Margin
member.summary: Gets or sets the outer margin of an element using percent value from 0 to 100. This property doesn't have any effect if MarginType property is set to Auto.
member.remarks: The property uses percent as an unit, which means that the values for the left, top, right, and bottom of the bounding rectangle have to be values between 0 and 100. This relative layout will produce proportional resizing of the chart element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Scene.MarginType
member.summary: Gets or sets a margin type for the chart element. If MarginType property is Percent, the Margin property has to be set.
member.remarks: The margin type can be set to Auto or Percent. The default value is Auto, and the position of the chart element is automatically created. For manual positioning the MarginType has to be set to Percent.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Scene.Perspective
member.summary: Gets or sets perspective level for 3D charts, ranging in value from 0 to 100.
member.remarks: A value of 100 represents 100%, meaning the chart is rendered at full perspective. Perspective is the way in which objects appear to the eye based on their dimensions and the position. For example, the parallel lines of a railway track are perceived as meeting at a distant point at the horizon. As objects become more distant, they begin to appear smaller.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Scene.DataFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the series are filtered if they have more than 1000 data points. This property is used to improve rendering performance for Line 2D, ScatterLine 2D and Area 2D chart.
member.remarks: This property activates an algorithm which replaces a group of data points with one and increase performance. This algorithm is activated only if there are more than 1000 data points in the series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.DataPoint.ChartParameters
member.summary: Gets or sets chart parameters for this data point.

remarks.p: Chart parameters are used to decrese the number of public properties used in series and data points. Used for numerous number of parameters which are different for every chart type.
If chart parameter is specified for a series it will apply on every data point from the series. If a chart parameter is set for a data point, the chart parameter from the series will be ignored.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.DataPoint.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of a data point. The value property is not used for all chart types. Scatter,Stock, Candlestick and Bubble chart types use ChartParameters: ValueX, ValueY, ValueZ, Radius, High, Low, Open, Close.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.DataPoint.Label
member.summary: Gets or sets data point label. Data point label stores text values for axis labels.

remarks.p: To change appearance of the axis labels, font properties from the Labels (See Labels property from Axis) has to be used. The label property of a DataPoint is used to store text value only. Some chart types like pie or doughnut use data point labels for legend items.
Important! If a chart has multiple series only Data Points from the first series are used to fill axis labels. All other series are ignored.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.DataPoint.ExtraParameters
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to additional ChartParameterCollection. This collection is used for chart parameter styling purposes.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.DataPoint.Fill
member.summary: Gets or sets the Brush that specifies how to paint the interior of the shape.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.DataPoint.Stroke
member.summary: Gets or sets the Brush that specifies how to paint the Shape outline.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.DataPoint.IsMouseOver
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the mouse pointer is located over this element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.DataPoint.StrokeThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the Shape outline.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.DataPoint.Animation
member.summary: Gets or sets the animation for Data Point. This animation is different for every chart type.
member.remarks: This animation is used only when one data point has to be animated asynchronously from another data points. The most common use of animation is from series, when data points are animated together. This animation is only used to create growing effect, but data point animation could be also created using brush property and WPF animation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.DataPoint.Marker
member.summary: Gets or sets the marker. Marker is a colored shape which shows exact value of a Data Point. Marker has corresponding marker label. Used in combination with different chart types.

remarks.p: Markers can be defined for series or data points. If Marker is not defined for DataPoint, the marker from parent series is used.
Some chart types dont use marker shapes or marker labels. Chart types without Axis dont have marker shapes (pie or doughnut charts). 3D Charts dont have marker shapes, they have marker labels only.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.DataPoint.ToolTip
member.summary: Gets or sets the tool-tip object that is displayed for .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.DataPoint.NullValue
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the Data Point has Null value.
member.remarks: By default NullValue is set to false. If NullValue is set to true data point is not drawn. After data binding every value from the data source which is DBNull will be set to 0 and NullValue will be set to true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Legend.Margin
member.summary: Gets or sets the outer margin of an element using percent value from 0 to 100. This property doesn't have any effect if MarginType property is set to Auto.
member.remarks: The property uses percent as an unit, which means that the values for the left, top, right, and bottom of the bounding rectangle have to be values between 0 and 100. This relative layout will produce proportional resizing of the chart elements.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.LightCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of lights. Light is abstract class and model3D object that represents lighting applied to a 3-D scene. Light could be: Ambient, Directional, Point and Spot light.
member.remarks: For 3D charts, by default, a light effect is created with default values (one DirectionalLight object, and one PointLight object). However, if you want to change the Light effect for the 3D scene, you need to create a Light effect and add it to the Lights collection. When you add a Light effect to the collection, the default Light effect disappears, and only newly created Light effects can be used.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Marker
member.summary: Marker is a colored shape which shows exact value of a Data Point. Marker has corresponding marker label. Used in combination with different chart types. Marker class keeps information about marker shapes and corresponding label appearance. Markers can be defined for series or data points. If Marker is not defined for DataPoint, the marker from parent series is used.
member.remarks: Some chart types dont use marker shapes or marker labels. Chart types without Axis dont have marker shapes (pie or doughnut charts). 3D Charts dont have marker shapes, they have marker labels only.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Marker.FontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the font size for Data Point Marker Label.
member.remarks: A double value specifying the desired font size to use in points (1 point = 1/72 of an inch = 96/72 device independent pixels). The default value is determined by the MessageFontSize metric.

member.summary: Gets or sets the marker font style.
member.remarks: The default value for FontStyle is Normal.

member.summary: Gets or sets the weight or thickness of the specified font.
member.remarks: A FontWeight enumeration value. The default value is Normal.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Marker.FontStretch
member.summary: Gets or sets the degree to which a font is condensed or expanded on the screen.
member.remarks: A member of the FontStretch class specifying the desired font-stretching characteristics to use. The default value is Normal.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Marker.Foreground
member.summary: Gets or sets the Brush to apply to the text contents of labels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Marker.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets data point label format using the composite string formatting.
member.remarks: This property is used to format data point label string. Data point label should use data point value which will be formatted on specified way and inserted into a text. Data Label format uses .NET Composite Formatting specification. The {Value} text is replaced with data point value. For Bubble, scatter and stock chart types {ValueX}, {ValueY}, {Radius}, {High}, {Low}, etc. formats are used. For example, to create a label which displays a text Data point value is: 3 where 3 is data point value, we have to create a following format string Data point value is: {Value}. Few more examples: 1. Product price is: $3.00 dollars -> Product price is: {Value:C} dollars. 2. Calculated value is: 03.00 -> Calculated value is: {Value:00.00}. For more information about format property see Composite Formatting in .NET Framework Developers Guide.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Marker.MarkerSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the marker size. This is scaling factor applied to the default marker size. Value 1 is default size, a value between 0 and 1 decrease the default marker size and a value greater than 1 increase the default marker size.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Marker.LabelDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the label distance. This is scaling factor applied to the default label distance from the marker. Value 1 is default size, a value between 0 and 1 decrease the default distance and a value greater than 1 increase the default distance.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.RenderingMode
member.summary: Rendering mode is used to improve rendering performance for a big number of data points. If the value is Auto Rendering mode depends on number of data points. If the number of points is greater than 100 the performance mode is active. When Performance mode is active, some wpf features are disabled (animation, backgrounds, themes, data templates, etc). Auto is default value.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.RenderingMode.Auto
member.summary: If Auto mode is active the rendering mode depends on the number of data points. If the number of points is greater than 100 the performance mode is active.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.RenderingMode.Full
member.summary: Used for high quality rendering. All wpf features are enabled (animation, backgrounds, themes, data templates, etc).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.RenderingMode.Performance
member.summary: Used for fast rendering of data points. When Performance mode is active, some wpf features are disabled (animation, backgrounds, themes, data templates, etc).

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType
member.summary: Chart types used both for 2D and 3D

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.Pie
member.summary: A pie chart is a circular chart divided into sectors proportional to the percentages of the whole. A pie chart always shows a single data series, and is useful for determining which item or items in the series are most significant.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.Line
member.summary: Line chart has data points plotted in series using evenly-spaced intervals and connected with a line to emphasize the relationships between the points.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.Area
member.summary: An area chart displays series as a set of points connected by a line with the area below the line filled in. Values are represented on the y-axis and categories are displayed on the x-axis.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.Column
member.summary: A column chart shows data points as rectangles which starts at the crossing value and ends at the value which corresponds to the data point value.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.Bubble
member.summary: A bubble chart shows data points using the first value for position end second value for relative radius.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.Bar
member.summary: A bar chart shows data points as rectangles which starts at the crossing value and ends at the value which corresponds to the data point value. Similar to the column chart but it has horizontal orientation.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.Doughnut
member.summary: Like a pie chart, a doughnut chart shows the size of items that make up a data series proportional to the total of the items in the series.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.Cylinder
member.summary: Cylinder chart looks like round column chart in 3D space. In 2D, cylinder chart is the same as column chart.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.CylinderBar
member.summary: Cylinder Bar chart looks like round bar chart in 3D space. In 2D, cylinder bar chart is the same as bar chart.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.Spline
member.summary: Spline chart has similar functionality as line chart. Line chart has data points connected with the strait lines and spline chart has data points connected with the smooth curve.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.StackedColumn
member.summary: A stacked column chart is used to show cumulative values of data points which belong to different data series and have same index or position inside parent series.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.StackedBar
member.summary: A stacked bar chart is used to show cumulative values of data points which belong to different data series and have same index or position inside parent series.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.StackedArea
member.summary: A stacked area chart is used to show cumulative values of data points which belong to different data series and have same index or position inside parent series.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.StackedCylinder
member.summary: Stacked cylinder chart looks like round stacked column chart in 3D space. In 2D, stacked cylinder chart is the same as stacked column chart.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.StackedCylinderBar
member.summary: Stacked cylinder bar chart looks like round stacked bar chart in 3D space. In 2D, stacked cylinder bar chart is the same as stacked bar chart.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.Stacked100Column
member.summary: A stacked 100% column chart is used to show relative cumulative values of data points (in percentages) which belong to different data series and have same index or position inside parent series.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.Stacked100Cylinder
member.summary: Stacked 100% cylinder chart looks like rounded stacked 100% column chart in 3D space. In 2D, stacked 100 % cylinder chart is the same as stacked 100% column chart.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.Stacked100CylinderBar
member.summary: Stacked 100% cylinder bar chart looks like rounded stacked 100% bar chart in 3D space. In 2D, stacked 100 % cylinder bar chart is the same as stacked 100% bar chart.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.Stacked100Bar
member.summary: A stacked 100% bar chart is used to show relative cumulative values of data points (in percentages) which belong to different data series and have same index or position inside parent series.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.Stacked100Area
member.summary: A stacked 100% area chart is used to show relative cumulative values of data points (in percentages) which belong to different data series and have same index or position inside parent series.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.Scatter
member.summary: Scatter chart type is a point chart which uses two value axis (or 3 value axis in 3D). Defined with X, Y and Z values from Chart parameters. This chart type does not use Value property from data point!

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.ScatterLine
member.summary: Scatter line chart type is a line chart which uses two value axis (or 3 value axis in 3D). Defined with X, Y and Z values from Chart parameters. This chart type does not use Value property from data point!

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.Stock
member.summary: Stock chart type is used to show stock market prices during the period of time. Every data point shows High, Low, Open and Close prices. High and Low prices are connected with vertical line, Open and Close prices are presented as horizontal lines from left or right side of the main vertical line. This chart type does not use Value property from data point! Instead, Chart parameters (High, Low, Open and Close) are used as a data point values.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.ChartType.Candlestick
member.summary: Candlestick chart type is used to show stock market prices during the period of time. Every data point shows High, Low, Open and Close prices. Open and Close prices are connected with a rectangle, which fill color depends on negative or positive difference between Open and Close price. This chart type does not use Value property from data point! Insted, Chart parameters (High, Low, Open and Close) are used as a data point values.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Series
member.summary: Series is used as a container for . Has data binding functionality and default appearance for all data points if appearance is not specified per data point.
member.remarks: When a chart is deployed on the page, a default column chart appears with two series. This default chart does not contain any data, but when the chart is placed into a visual design surface, the chart automatically creates demo data to give it some appearance will it is being worked with, or until you supply your data. As soon as you add actual data to the control, the demo data disappears from the chart. You cannot change the sample data because it does not exist in the Series collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Series.ChartParameters
member.summary: Gets or sets chart parameters for this series.

remarks.p: Chart parameters are used to decrese the number of public properties used in series and data points. Used for numerous number of parameters which are different for every chart type.
If chart parameter is specified for a series it will apply on every data point from the series. If a chart parameter is set for a data point, the chart parameter from the series will be ignored.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Series.ChartType
member.summary: Gets or sets a chart type used for this data series. For 3D chart types, property of the control has to be set to true.
member.para: Refer to the Chart Types topic in the Developer's Guide for a explanation of the various chart types.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Series.DataPointColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates a way on which data points get colors. By default colors for data points depend on chart type (for example pie chart have different colors for every data point and column chart have same color for all points).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Series.DataMapping
member.summary: Gets or sets an expression string used to define data binding. In the simplest case, this is just a column name from a data table.
member.remarks:
If just a column name is specified, the values from data table will be bound to property of a . To specify multiple binding it is necessary to divide column and value names using ; character (For example: "X = myXColumn; Y = myYColumn"). The Character = is used to split Property Value name from Column name (For example: "Value = mySalePrice"). In the following text we have few examples of data binding:
If Just column name is used "XColumn" the value will be bind to the Value property of a data point. We can also use following syntax to bind to the value property: "Value = myXColumn".
This example shows how to bind data for the scatter chart: "ValueX = myXColumn; ValueY = myYColumn; ValueZ = myZColumn". X, Y and Z are .
The next example shows how to bind data for the stock chart: "High = myHiColumnName; Low = myLowColumnName; Open = myOpenColumnName; Close = myCloseColumnName". High, Low, Open and Close are .
At the end we have example of binding data to the bubble chart: "ValueX = myXColumn; ValueY = myYColumn; ValueZ = myZColumn; Radius = myRColumn", where myXColumn, myYColumn, myZColumn and myRColumn are column names from your data base.
Contrary to the property of the , ValueX, ValueY, ValueZ, Radius, High, Low, Open and Close values are and can be found in the collection (data points property). Data Binding process creates data points and chart parameters inside data points (if necessary for scatter, bubble, stock, etc.) and fill collection of data points from .
member.para: Refer to the Data Mapping topic in the Developer's Guide for a explanation of the various chart types data binding.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Series.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a data source used to bind data to this series. Data source could be DataSet, DataTable, Collection, XML Data source, etc.
member.remarks: A is created for every record, and the property of the data point will be filled with a value from the specified data source. The series will be filled with created data points. If property is not specified, only the property from data point will be set. To fill or (Chart parameters keep values for Stock or Scatter chart types), the property from the series has to be used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Series.Fill
member.summary: Gets or sets the Brush that specifies how to paint the interior of the shape.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Series.Stroke
member.summary: Gets or sets the Brush that specifies how to paint the Shape outline.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Series.StrokeThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the Shape outline.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Series.Animation
member.summary: Gets or sets the animation for Series. This animation is different for every chart type.
member.remarks: This animation is used only when one data point has to be animated synchronously with another data points. Data Points could be animated using animation property from data points, but the most common use of animation is from series, when data points are animated together. This animation is only used to create growing effect, but data point animation could be also created using brush property and WPF animation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Series.Label
member.summary: Gets or sets series label. Series labels stores text values for the legend. In 3D they are used for category Z labels also.

remarks.p: To change appearance of the legend items the font properties from the Legend has to be used. Label property of a Series is used only to store a text value.
Important! Some chart types like pie or doughnut use data point labels for legend items.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Series.Marker
member.summary: Gets or sets the marker. Marker is a colored shape which shows exact value of a Data Point. Marker has corresponding marker label. Used in combination with different chart types.

remarks.p: Markers can be defined for series or data points. If Marker is not defined for DataPoint, the marker from parent series is used.
Some chart types dont use marker shapes or marker labels. Chart types without Axis dont have marker shapes (pie or doughnut charts). 3D Charts dont have marker shapes, they have marker labels only.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Series.AxisX
member.summary: Gets or sets the X Axis Name. Used to make connection between Series and Axes for Secondary axes.
member.remarks: Every series needs X and Y axes for 2D charts and X, Y and Z axes for 3D charts. Every chart scene can have 5 axes 3 Primary and 2 secondary (3D charts cannot have secondary axes). For example, series can use only one X axis, and it could be primary or secondary. To specify which axis we want to use we have to set the same text for AxisX property of the Series and the property of an axis. If those properties are empty the primary axes are used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Chart.Series.AxisY
member.summary: Gets or sets the Y Axis Name. Used to make connection between Series and Axes for Secondary axes.
member.remarks: Every series needs X and Y axes for 2D charts and X, Y and Z axes for 3D charts. Every chart scene can have 5 axes 3 Primary and 2 secondary (3D charts cannot have secondary axes). For example, series can use only one Y axis, and it could be primary or secondary. To specify which axis we want to use we have to set the same text for AxisY property of the Series and the property of an axis. If those properties are empty the primary axes are used.
